data.title: Family Notices from Jersey Evening Post
data.meta_description: Search and book family announcements including birth, anniversary, engagement, marriage and death notices in Jersey, Channel Islands.
data.text:
Passed away peacefully on Saturday, 10 August, 2024, with her family around her. She bravely and acceptingly fought a full ten years of medical conditions, which she did with dignity. She left her daughters Karen and Nicky, friend to Charlton, Nanny to Lawrence and Emma and in a few short months would have met her first great-granddaughter of which she was very excited.

Positive Steps cared for her at home, which was her wish, and the carers became strong friends. Our thanks to the staff of Plemont Ward for looking after all of us in her last few days, especially during her time with oncology, the love, support and friendship they gave, but most of all to Dr Rubin Soomal.

Funeral details to follow.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Passed away peacefully on Sunday, 11 August, 2024 in the presence of his family at the Jersey General Hospital ICU, aged 85 years. Loving husband to the late Carmen Manti, beloved father to Sebastian, Tony, Pili, Tom and Ignacio, loving father-in-law to Dawn, Neil and Susan and adored grandfather (Nonno) to Joshua, Leona, Julian and Corentin. Tommaso was greatly loved and will be missed every day.

The family would like to thank everyone involved with Tommaso’s exceptional care in the ICU during his last weeks in the hospital.

‘Sanctum’ by Beulah B Malkin.

I built a tiny garden, in a corner of my heart,

I kept it just for lovely things and bade all else depart.

And ever was there music and flowers blossomed fair,

And never was it perfect, until you entered there.

This day comes with sad regret, it brings a day I’ll never forget.

If you could have spoken before you died, these are the words you would have replied.

‘I loved you all to the very last, weep not for me but courage take, love each other for my sake’.

Love Angela xx.

Fondest memories of a special Dad who passed away one year ago.

We think of you in silence, we often speak your name,

But all we have are memories and your picture in a frame.

Your resting place we visit and put flowers there with care,

But no one knows the heartache, as we turn and leave you there.

Forever in our hearts and thoughts.

Love always, Rob and Lynda, Richard and Marion xxxx.

Papa, we miss you more than words can express.

Loved and remembered every day, Rachel, Matthew and Joe xxx.

Died peacefully in Warwickshire on Sunday, 4 August, 2024 after a short illness, aged 96, and is now reunited with his adored wife Susan. He will be missed by the many people whose lives he touched, but especially by his brother Richard, and his children, Katharine, Philip, Elisabeth, David and Rachel and their families.

The funeral will take place at Romsey Abbey on Thursday, 5 September at 11.30 am.

A memorial service will be held at St Brelade’s Church on Sunday, 8 September at 3 pm, followed by tea in the church hall.

All are welcome.

Donations received in Michael’s memory (www.ahcheater.co.uk/funeral-notices-and-donations) will be sent to the Church Urban Fund, a cause close to his heart.

Passed away peacefully on Sunday, 11 August, 2024 in the presence of his family at the Jersey General Hospital ICU, aged 85 years. Loving husband to the late Carmen Manti, beloved father to Sebastian, Tony, Pili and Ignacio, loving father-in-law to Dawn, Neil and Susan and adored grandfather (Nonno) to Joshua, Leona, Julian and Corentin. Tommaso was greatly loved and will be missed every day.

The family would like to thank everyone involved with Tommaso’s exceptional care in the ICU during his last weeks in the hospital.

‘Sanctum’ by Beulah B Malkin.

I built a tiny garden, in a corner of my heart,

I kept it just for lovely things and bade all else depart.

And ever was there music and flowers blossomed fair,

And never was it perfect, until you entered there.

David, Michael and families would like to thank all those who attended our parents recent funeral and for the kind cards, messages and donations to Parkinson’s Jersey. A special thanks to the staff at Silver Springs Care Home for the incredible care, help and support provided to our parents and our families over the last couple of years. Many thanks also to Gary and Shane and the rest of the staff at De Gruchy’s for arranging such a fitting send off for our parents. Finally, a special thank you to Rev Martin Evans for conducting such a meaningful and heartfelt service celebrating our parents’ lives.

Passed away in the care of the General Hospital on Wednesday, 7 August, 2024 aged 86 years. Now reunited with Peter, much-loved Mum to Mandy and Nick. Mary will be missed by all her family and friends.

Funeral Service

Mary’s funeral service will take place on Wednesday, 4 September at 11.30 am in St Patricks Catholic Church followed by a private cremation.

Family flowers only.

Donations in Mary’s memory can be offered to The Peter Barton Fund, c/o St Clements Parish Hall, La Grande Route de la Cote, St Clement, JE2 6FP, ref Mrs Mary Barton.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Passed away suddenly on Sunday, 28 July, 2024, aged 57, loving partner of Richard III, beloved mother of Megan and Jake and Nanny to Erin, Caoimhe and Ada. She will be sorely missed.

Funeral Service

Family and friends wishing to attend the funeral service of Fiona are invited to meet at the Crematorium Chapel, St Helier, on Thursday, 5 September at 1 pm.

No flowers please.

Donations in lieu of flowers, if desired, may be sent to Dementia Jersey, Osprey House, Old Street, St Helier, JE2 3RG.

All inquiries to De Gruchy’s Funeral Care, telephone 499444.

Passed away peacefully at home on Monday, 5 August, 2024, aged 75 years, devoted partner to Jacqueline, very much-loved by Terence, Karen, Melissa and Kimberley. Duncan will deeply missed by all his family and friends.

Funeral Service

Duncan’s funeral service will take place on Tuesday, 20 August at 11.30 am in the Crematorium Chapel, Westmount.

Family flowers only and no mourning clothes.

Donations in Duncan’s memory would be welcomed to Jersey Hospice Care, Clarkson House, Mont Cochon, St Helier, JE2 3JB.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Passed away peacefully at Lakeside Care Home, on Wednesday, 7 August, 2024, aged 95 years, much-loved mother, grandmother, great-grandmother and beloved wife of the late John. Now reunited.

Funeral Service

Family and friends wishing to attend the memorial service for the life of Roselle are invited to meet at Ebenezer Church, Trinity on Saturday, 17 August at noon.

A private cremation will take place.

Flowers are welcome and should arrive at the offices of Pitcher & Le Quesne no later than noon the day before the memorial service.

If desired, please make any donations in lieu of flowers in memory of Roselle to Methodist Homes for the Aged (Jersey) Limited, c/o Leanne Green, Administrator Maison La Corderie, Green Street, St Helier, JE2 4UG.

All inquiries to Pitcher & Le Quesne, Funeral Directors, telephone 733330 or email enquiries@pitcherlequesne.com

Passed away peacefully in the tender care of Jersey Hospice on Friday, 2 August, 2024, aged 92, beloved wife of the late Alastair Fairlie, adored mother to Carlo, Helena and Graeme and a much-loved grandmother and great-grandmother.

Funeral Services

Relatives and friends wishing to attend the funeral service are invited to meet at Grouville Parish Church on Thursday, 22 August at 11 am.

Family Flowers only.

Donations in lieu of flowers may be sent to Jersey Hospice Care or Jersey Stroke Association.

All inquiries to Maillards, Funeral Directors, telephone 737291.
